document_data.mainbody:
King Caladorn the Wise was a ruler of the realm of Ulgarth in southeast Faer√ªn before the 14th century DR.
King Caladorn decreed that priests could not judge a persons worldly behavior. As a result, priests could not serve as either kings justices or barons justices in the kingdom.
The lieko, the gold coin currency of the realm used circa 1367 DR, bore an image of King Caladorn the Wise on the front, with a mounted knight on the back.
